alert.note: Alert for Columbia; McDuffie (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 2:52PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Georgia, including the following counties, Columbia and McDuffie. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 250 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thomson, Thomson-McDuffie County Airport, Dearing, Boneville, McDuffie County Fire Department, Sweetwater Park, McDuffie Regional Medical Center, Thomson Fire Department, Arties Pond Public Fishing Area, White Oak Campground, Ansley Mill, University Hospital McDuffie, Autney, Adamsville and Carpenter Airport. Streams affected in McDuffie County include Bonneville Stream, Dry Branch and Sweetwater Creek. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 169 and 179. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown.
